title: California Soul...
content:
Anybody got any ideas for the ID of the fonts here? [http://www.hollisterco.com/club\_cali/cali\_soul/flash/cs\_main.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141106221125/http:/www.hollisterco.com/club_cali/cali_soul/flash/cs_main.html)   
   
And if any of you have any good suggestions for some similar fonts that would good with this style of stuff...please hook me up!   
   
Thanks guys & gals   
The Danger.
author: dangerboy

comments.content:
The California Soul, imo, is a straight scan from a   
vintage California tourist-type tee or postcard.   
   
It features a mix of italic and script forms.   
   
The 'Soul' looks tacked on House Industries, I think   
from the Vegas set...   
   
Similar fonts can be found by checking out myfonts.com   
and typing keyword 70s.   
   
Just three off the top, Lazybones, Candice, and Octopuss.

For California take a look also at [Spills](http://web.archive.org/web/20141106221125/http:/www2.comicbookfonts.com/e/env/0001TuFycJLIlfEsmQ2l2i0/fonts/font_list.html?link=/fonts/DL/catalog.html&item=fonts:dl205) and [Fenway Park](http://web.archive.org/web/20141106221125/http:/www.veer.com/results.asp?image=JBT0000019).

Tom,   
The way California wraps around itself with the swash letters strongly says "art work" not font. In addition to Ignacio's suggestions Letterhead fonts has two fonts that come with a variety of underlining swashes:   
 [Pilsner and Ephemera](http://web.archive.org/web/20141106221125/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/styles/script.shtml). With the right graphics tools you could make some pretty fancy lettering with those.
